entry.title: Bhargavxyz738/Lazy-CSS: Lazy CSS is a lightweight, utility-first CSS framework that generates styles on-demand as you use them in your HTML or JSX. It offers a Tailwind-like experience but with a "lazy" approach, minimizing CSS overhead. Supports vanilla JS and React, with easy configuration and a wide range of pre-defined utilities and color palettes.
entry.content: Lazy CSS is a lightweight, utility-first CSS framework that generates styles on-demand as you use them in your HTML or JSX. It offers a Tailwind-like experience but with a "lazy" approach, minimizing CSS overhead. Supports vanilla JS and React, with easy configuration and a wide range of pre-defined utilities and color palettes.

entry.title: xayanide/event-handler-loader: A simple and lightweight way to load event handlers from a directory and attach them to any EventEmitter-like instance. It's in its early stages, there may be lots of incoming breaking changes.

entry.title: JBerendes/PlayMyPodcast: PlayMyPodcast is a lightweight, serverless app that transforms your podcast RSS feed into a seamless, voice-controlled listening experience on Google Home. It fetches and parses your podcast feed, creating a playable playlist with support for standard media commands like play, pause, and skip.
entry.content: PlayMyPodcast is a lightweight, serverless app that transforms your podcast RSS feed into a seamless, voice-controlled listening experience on Google Home. It fetches and parses your podcast feed, creating a playable playlist with support for standard media commands like play, pause, and skip.
